getMainView

public java.lang.String getMainView()
Get the main view. Main view is the default view shown to user when he opens application without specifying view uri.

Returns:
Uri of the main view.

setMainView

public void setMainView(java.lang.String mainViewUri)
Set the main view. Main view is the default view shown to user when he opens application without specifying view uri. If main view has not been set, the first view registered with addView() is used as main view. Note that the view must be registered with addView() before calling this method.

Parameters:
mainViewUri - Uri of the main view.

addView

public void addView(java.lang.String uri,
                    java.lang.Class<? extends com.vaadin.ui.Component> viewClass)
Add a new view to navigator. Register a view to navigator.

Parameters:
uri - String that identifies a view. This is the string that is shown in URL after #
viewClass - Component class that implements TabNavigator.View interface

removeView

public void removeView(java.lang.String uri)
Remove view from navigator.

Parameters:
uri - Uri of the view to remove.

getUri

public java.lang.String getUri(java.lang.Class<? extends com.vaadin.ui.Component> viewClass)
Get the uri for given view implementation class.

Parameters:
viewClass - Class that implements the view.
Returns:
Uri registered for the view class.

getViewClass

public java.lang.Class<?> getViewClass(java.lang.String uri)
Get the view class for given uri.

Parameters:
uri - Uri to get view for
Returns:
View that corresponds to the uri

navigateTo

public void navigateTo(java.lang.String uri)
Switch to view identified with uri. Uri can be either the exact uri registered previously with addView() or it can also contain data id passed to the view. In case data id is included, the format is 'uri/freeFormedDataIdString'.

Parameters:
uri - Uri where to navigate.

navigateTo

public void navigateTo(java.lang.Class<? extends com.vaadin.ui.Component> viewClass)
Switch to view implemented by given class. Note that the view must be registered to navigator with addView() before calling this method.

Parameters:
viewClass - Class that implements the view.

addListener

public void addListener(TabNavigator.ViewChangeListener listener)
Listen to the view changes. The listener will get notified after the view has changed.

Parameters:
listener - Listener to invoke after view changes.

removeListener

public void removeListener(TabNavigator.ViewChangeListener listener)
Remove the view change listener.

Parameters:
listener - Listener to remove.

getWindow

public static com.vaadin.ui.Window getWindow(TabNavigator.NavigableApplication application,
                                             java.lang.String name,
                                             com.vaadin.ui.Window superGetWindow)
Helper for overriding Application.getWindow(String).

This helper makes implementing support for multiple browser tabs or browser windows easy. Just override Application.getWindow(String) in your application like this: 

 @Override
 public Window getWindow(String name) {
        return TabNavigator.getWindow(this, name, super.getWindow(name));
 }

Parameters:
application - Application instance, which implements TabNavigator.NavigableApplication interface.
name - Name parameter from Application.getWindow(String name)
superGetWindow - The window returned by super.getWindow(name)
Returns:
